name: Terraform Cloud
description: This app integrates with Terraform Cloud to perform generic and investigative actions to manage runs, plans, and applies

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration

organization_name.description: Name of the organization to list the workspaces of

page_size.description: Number of workspaces to return per page (100 is default)

id.description: Name of the organization to list the workspaces of

page_size.description: Number of runs to return per page (20 is default)

actions.description: Create a run which will perform a plan and apply
actions.verbose: NOTE: This endpoint must be accessed using either a user token or a team token. A run performs a plan and applies, using a configuration version and the workspace's current variables. You can specify a configuration version when creating a run; if you don't provide one, the run defaults to the workspace's most recently used version. (A configuration version is 'used' when it is created or used for a run in this workspace.).

workspace_id.description: ID of workspace where the run will be executed

configuration_version.description: Configuration version to use for this run. If blank, latest config is used

message.description: Message to be associated with this run
message.default: Queued manually via the Terraform Enterprise API

is_destroy.description: Specify if this plan is a destroy plan, which will destroy all provisioned resources

actions.verbose: Workspace creation is restricted to members of the owner's team, the owner's team API token, and the organization API token. The organization must already exist in the system, and the user must have permission to create new workspaces.

organization_name.description: Name of the organization to create the workspace within Terraform

vcs_repo_id.description: Reference to your VSC repo in the format :org/:repo

vcs_token_id.description: Token ID of the VSC repo

file_triggers_enabled.description: Whether to filter runs based on the changed files in a VCS push

auto_apply.description: Automatically apply changes when plan is successful

queue_all_runs.description: Whether runs should be queued immediately after workspace creation

actions.description: Applies a run that is paused waiting for confirmation after a plan
actions.verbose:
This includes runs in the 'needs confirmation' and 'policy checked' states. This action is only required for runs that can't be auto-applied. (Plans can be auto-applied if the auto-apply setting is enabled on the workspace, the plan is not a destroy plan, and the plan was not queued by a user without write permissions.)
This endpoint queues the request to perform an apply; the apply might not happen immediately.
This endpoint represents an action as opposed to a resource. As such, the endpoint does not return any object in the response body.

id.description: The ID of the run to apply

comment.description: An optional comment about the run

actions.verbose: There is no endpoint to list applies. You can find the ID for an apply in the 'relationships.apply' property of a run object.

id.description: The ID of the apply to show

actions.description: Get details and status of the plan of a run in Terraform
actions.verbose: There is no endpoint to list plans. You can find the ID for a plan in the 'relationships.plan' property of a run object.

id.description: The ID of the plan to show

actions.description: This endpoint is used for showing details of a specific run

id.description: The ID of the run to retrieve details

actions.verbose: Details on a workspace can be retrieved from two endpoints, which behave identically. One refers to a workspace by its ID, and the other by its name and organization.

id.description: The ID of the workspace to show

organization_name.description: The name of the organization to retrieve workspace details

workspace_name.description: The name of the workspace to retrieve details
